machine operator

Company Name Randstad Australia Company Location Truganina, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 35 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

Visy began manufacturing corrugated cardboard boxes in Melbourne in 1948 and has grown to become one of the world’s leading privately owned packaging, paper and recycling companies. It is through the success, dedication and innovation of Visy that has led to the construction of a new, state of the art, Visy Board plant in Truganina, Vic.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Machine Operator to join Visy Board, Truganina.
  • New and State of the art cardboard manufacturing operation
  • Truganina Location
  • Exciting Opportunity to join a progressive and successful business
This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a new operation and positive work culture from day one!

Visy is a leading, privately owned packaging and resource Recovery Company, with more than 120 sites across Australia, New Zealand, Thailand and Vietnam and trading offices across Asia, Europe and the USA.

The main objective of the role is to Operate state of the art machinery and associated equipment to meet agreed production, service and quality standards.

This position reports directly to Shift Supervisor.



Your Main Duties And Responsibilities Will Include
  • Working on the state of the art machines
  • Ensure equipment is correctly maintained; and that maintenance is performed to keep machines within specifications and in Safe working order.
  • Automated machine operating, truble shooting and quality checks
  • Operate Strapping line and associated equipment to meet agreed production, service and quality standards.
  • Be fully conversant on all aspects of the Strapping line and associated equipment.
  • Maintain Safe work and operating practices; maintain a high standard of housekeeping during production, at shift end and at scheduled maintenance.
  • Regularly review work processes and assist in identifying improvements to process and procedures.
  • Ensure a high level of safety and housekeeping is maintained at all times


To be considered for this role you will need to have the following capabilities;
  • Excellent Communication Skills are a MUST
  • Computer literate
  • Be an excellent team player
  • Have demonstrated machine operating experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Previous Forklift Experience -highly regarded but not essential
  • Prior Fibre Packaging industry knowledge - highly regarded
  • Ability to work a 2 week rotating roster: Day shift - roughly 6/7am starts / Arvo shift - roughly 3/4pm starts
  • Shifts will be approximately 10-12hrs long
  • Pleanty of overtime
All Visy employees should represent the company values of maintaining a safe work environment, strong customer relationships, acting with urgency, passion & energy for the business and a relentless pursuit of best value for customers!

If you feel this reflects your own values and you want to be a part of an exciting opportunity, do not delay in applying for this role!

At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Marketing Communications Coordinator

Company Name Deakin University Company Location Burwood, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 669 views

Job description


JOB ID: 180692
SALARY RANGE: $85,953 to $94,644 pa (plus 17% super)
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full-time (36.75 hours per week) and fixed term to 31 December 2019
LOCATION: Melbourne Burwood Campus

ABOUT THE ROLE

In this role you will be responsible for the provision of effective support and advice to the Manager, Marketing and Communications on the implementation of the Faculty's communications objectives, and you will be the formal deputy to the Manager.

This will include:

  • Researching, writing and developing a range of course promotional materials including writing, editing and designing course flyers, postcards and posters.
  • Leading the enhancement of the Faculty's digital presence through the development and creation of dynamic and engaging content for the Faculty and university websites and social media activity.
  • Coordinating and managing the Faculty's social media strategy, domestic and international advertising campaigns and search engine marketing (SEM) activity.
  • Supervising and coordinating the work activities of permanent and casual support staff in Digital Marketing.



ABOUT YOU

  • Graduate qualification in marketing, communication, or journalism, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Experience in the creation and optimisation of digital and web content with a deep understanding of online audiences and ability to tailor content to ensure strong engagement.
  • Experience in the development of print, digital, and interactive marketing and communications collateral.
  • High-level digital literacy including but not limited to an intermediate-advanced proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, the Adobe Creative Suite, and a range of Content Management Systems.


For a full list of the selection criteria please see the position description


CONTACT FOR FURTHER INFORMATION: Grace Darken, Tel: +61 3 9244 5598, Email: g.darken@deakin.edu.au

CLOSING DATE: Sunday 16 September 2018


We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Further information on Deakin's workplace benefits can be found here: deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin/why-work-at-deakin/staff-benefits

TO APPLY

For a full copy of the position description and to apply online, please visit deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin

Deakin University values diversity, enables access and promotes inclusion.

Deakin University is an employer of choice for women and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

849971151:
[

Technical Writer

Company Name REA Group Company Location Richmond, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 182 views

Job description


REA Group is expanding our internal developer platform capability. We are growing and maturing our suite of internal products that every REA team can benefit from and we'd love you to come help us.



About the role
Located within the Platform and Architecture tribe (PandA), is a new Developer Experience team who are focused on helping developers use our internal platforms. We are now looking for a Technical Writer to join this team to assist with providing meaningful documentation of our internal platforms to both non-technical and technical internal consumers. This entails tools, services and solutions that are used exclusively by REA's internal software delivery teams - the users. The channel of delivery for the documents produced is online only and the domain area is bespoke software development.



As PandA's Technical Writer you will:

  • Collaborate with the Senior Developer Advocate to define the best documentation strategy to cater for technical and non-technical audiences
  • Define alongside with users and product teams the needs for technical and non-technical documentation
  • Liaise, collaborate and interview product designers and developers to understand their products
  • Organise and write supporting documents using MarkDown and Git
  • Define the documentation Information Structure and roll-out of necessary changes across products
  • Use photographs, drawings, diagrams, animations, and charts that increase users' understanding of the product and facilitate learning




What we expect:

  • Someone to be an expert in transforming tech IT jargon into simple English words that can be understood by non-technical people
  • Excellent written skills in English
  • Aptitude to learn new tech writing methods/tools
  • An ability to get people excited about technology
  • The ability to empathise with our development teams and their needs
  • The ability to probe SME's for content or explanations to then analyse, reduce and distil the important parts of a product for different levels of technical proficiency
  • Collaborative in finding the best options for document consumers (e.g. language, tooling, presentation, etc.)
  • A demonstrated interest in technology especially software and/or infrastructure




Experience with any of the following is a massive bonus:

  • Previously written documents for both developers and product managers/owners
  • Any experience in a tech team (developer/system admin/UX/etc.)
  • Experience working in agile teams




What is it like to work with us in PandA?
PandA sits within Group Technology headed up by our Chief Engineer. We help REA build and run systems sustainably and our mission is to establish a platform to reduce friction as well as helping REA create a healthy software ecosystem. We provide and maintain infrastructure, delivery engineering and architecture services, tools and platforms that provide & promote aligned autonomy for our technical teams.



Each week we participate in guilds across the company to keep our skills sharp and increase our impact, and in team retrospectives where we keep track of how our team is going. Your manager acts as a mentor to help guide you and your career, instead of being someone who monitors your day to day.



We're committed to creating inclusive, safe environments where anyone, no matter their background, can contribute and succeed.



What you get beyond a great remuneration package

  • Birthday leave. A day off for your birthday.
  • Flexible working arrangements. We've got people who work part time, and people who work from home one day a week.
  • 3 days every 4 months in our regular hackathon - See: http://hackday.realestate.com.au
  • Industry-leading parental leave system.
  • Onsite health and wellbeing programs, including yoga and meditation classes along with showers and clean towels for when you work up a sweat.




About REA Group
Our leading brand is Australia's biggest property resource, realestate.com.au. We also operate the number one commercial property site, realcommercial.com.au, and have businesses that help property developers and other brands advertise with us. Whilst we live in Australia, we've also got ventures in Asia and North America, and have the vision of expanding our footprint further. Everything we do is driven by our purpose to 'change the way the world experiences property' - from product innovation to our international investments.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Online Media

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology
  • Writing/Editing
]

Lead, Customer Regulatory Reporting

Company Name National Australia Bank Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 135 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • \xa0 Lead and inspire
  • \xa0\xa0ATO Reporting
  • \xa0 Excellent career opportunity

At NAB, it's all about our people reaching their full potential. And in\xa0MLC that means transforming talent into a well defined career path.\xa0


In this role you will act as the key delivery lead to ensure accurate and timely delivery of customer reports to regulators within regulatory obligations and the NAB controls management framework. You will also coordinate and manage tasks and requirements to ensure that MLC meets its ATO reporting obligation, together with managing the quality of reporting e.g. perform testing and coordinating data integrity.


Reporting to the Head Of Reporting Delivery and Guardian your accountabilities will include, but are not limited to:


  • Ensure accurate and timely delivery of customer reports to the regulators
  • Manage the planning, oversight and delivery of regulatory reports
  • Key stakeholder in the development and delivery of regulatory reports
  • Lead any change impacts and ensure implementation is achieved at minimal risk
  • Proactively manage risk; meet all policy and compliance requirements; perform controls; adhere to process and procedures pertinent to role; and escalate events, issues or breaches as they are identified (risk accountability forms part of all roles, as everyone is responsible for managing risk and compliance).
  • Event Ownership, Management and Remediation completed within NAB policy, Regulatory timeliness and standards
  • Identifying opportunities to improve/standardise processes leading performance improvement initiatives
  • Support change and understand internal and external change in preparedness for ensuring NAB Wealth ongoing compliance where related to regulatory reporting to and from the regulators
  • Must work closely, proactively and independently with projects and multiple technology teams to understand and shape technology solutions and business processes to ensure that the Customer Regulatory Reporting team can successfully deliver on their obligations
  • To maintain and develop procedure maps and training material as changes are implemented
  • Analyse, gather and negotiate business requirements for required system changes in order to comply with our regulatory reporting obligations

This role will be a challenging and rewarding opportunity which will suit an individual who enjoys a varied workload and a focus on delivery.


You should be able to demonstrate experience in the following areas:


  • Setting objectives and delivering to a schedule
  • Developing and delivering business requirements
  • Experience in developing and delivering User Acceptance Testing
  • Good understanding of superannuation and investment business processes and the application of these processes in a customer-focused environment

For further information about this opportunity please refer to the attached Role Purpose Statement.


Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of this advertisement.


To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status.


We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

Mid-Senior level
